TITLE: Defining Module Configuration Options in Python
DESCRIPTION: Example from the nmap module showing how to define default configuration options and their descriptions in a BBOT module, and how to access these options in the setup method.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blacklanternsecurity/bbot/blob/stable/docs/dev/module_howto.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
class nmap(BaseModule):
    # ...
    options = {
        "top_ports": 100,
        "ports": "",
        "timing": "T4",
        "skip_host_discovery": True,
    }
    options_desc = {
        "top_ports": "Top ports to scan (default 100) (to override, specify 'ports')",
        "ports": "Ports to scan",
        "timing": "-T<0-5>: Set timing template (higher is faster)",
        "skip_host_discovery": "skip host discovery (-Pn)",
    }

    async def setup(self):
        self.ports = self.config.get("ports", "")
        self.timing = self.config.get("timing", "T4")
        self.top_ports = self.config.get("top_ports", 100)
        self.skip_host_discovery = self.config.get("skip_host_discovery", True)
        return True
```

TITLE: BBOT Command-Line Help Documentation
DESCRIPTION: Comprehensive help output for BBOT command-line interface. It details all available options including targeting, module selection, preset configuration, output formats, and provides usage examples.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blacklanternsecurity/bbot/blob/stable/docs/scanning/advanced.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
usage: bbot [-h] [-t TARGET [TARGET ...]] [-w WHITELIST [WHITELIST ...]]
               [-b BLACKLIST [BLACKLIST ...]] [--strict-scope]
               [-p [PRESET ...]] [-c [CONFIG ...]] [-lp]
               [-m MODULE [MODULE ...]] [-l] [-lmo] [-em MODULE [MODULE ...]]
               [-f FLAG [FLAG ...]] [-lf] [-rf FLAG [FLAG ...]]
               [-ef FLAG [FLAG ...]] [--allow-deadly] [-n SCAN_NAME] [-v] [-d]
               [-s] [--force] [-y] [--fast-mode] [--dry-run]
               [--current-preset] [--current-preset-full] [-mh MODULE]
               [-o DIR] [-om MODULE [MODULE ...]] [-lo] [--json] [--brief]
               [--event-types EVENT_TYPES [EVENT_TYPES ...]] [--exclude-cdn]
               [--no-deps | --force-deps | --retry-deps |
               --ignore-failed-deps | --install-all-deps] [--version]
               [--proxy HTTP_PROXY] [-H CUSTOM_HEADERS [CUSTOM_HEADERS ...]]
               [--custom-yara-rules CUSTOM_YARA_RULES]
               [--user-agent USER_AGENT]

Bighuge BLS OSINT Tool

options:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit

Target:
  -t, --targets TARGET [TARGET ...]
                        Targets to seed the scan
  -w, --whitelist WHITELIST [WHITELIST ...]
                        What's considered in-scope (by default it's the same as --targets)
  -b, --blacklist BLACKLIST [BLACKLIST ...]
                        Don't touch these things
  --strict-scope        Don't consider subdomains of target/whitelist to be in-scope

Presets:
  -p, --preset [PRESET ...]
                        Enable BBOT preset(s)
  -c, --config [CONFIG ...]
                        Custom config options in key=value format: e.g. 'modules.shodan.api_key=1234'
  -lp, --list-presets   List available presets.

Modules:
  -m, --modules MODULE [MODULE ...]
                        Modules to enable. Choices: affiliates,ajaxpro,anubisdb,apkpure,asn,azure_realm,azure_tenant,baddns,baddns_direct,baddns_zone,badsecrets,bevigil,binaryedge,bucket_amazon,bucket_azure,bucket_digitalocean,bucket_file_enum,bucket_firebase,bucket_google,bufferoverrun,builtwith,bypass403,c99,censys,certspotter,chaos,code_repository,credshed,crt,crt_db,dastardly,dehashed,digitorus,dnsbimi,dnsbrute,dnsbrute_mutations,dnscaa,dnscommonsrv,dnsdumpster,dnstlsrpt,docker_pull,dockerhub,dotnetnuke,emailformat,extractous,ffuf,ffuf_shortnames,filedownload,fingerprintx,fullhunt,generic_ssrf,git,git_clone,gitdumper,github_codesearch,github_org,github_workflows,gitlab,google_playstore,gowitness,hackertarget,host_header,httpx,hunt,hunterio,iis_shortnames,ip2location,ipneighbor,ipstack,jadx,leakix,myssl,newsletters,ntlm,nuclei,oauth,otx,paramminer_cookies,paramminer_getparams,paramminer_headers,passivetotal,pgp,portfilter,portscan,postman,postman_download,rapiddns,robots,securitytrails,securitytxt,shodan_dns,shodan_idb,sitedossier,skymem,smuggler,social,sslcert,subdomaincenter,subdomainradar,telerik,trickest,trufflehog,url_manipulation,urlscan,vhost,viewdns,virustotal,wafw00f,wappalyzer,wayback,wpscan,zoomeye
  -l, --list-modules    List available modules.
  -lmo, --list-module-options
                        Show all module config options
  -em, --exclude-modules MODULE [MODULE ...]
                        Exclude these modules.
  -f, --flags FLAG [FLAG ...]
                        Enable modules by flag. Choices: active,affiliates,aggressive,baddns,cloud-enum,code-enum,deadly,email-enum,iis-shortnames,passive,portscan,report,safe,service-enum,slow,social-enum,subdomain-enum,subdomain-hijack,web-basic,web-paramminer,web-screenshots,web-thorough
  -lf, --list-flags     List available flags.
  -rf, --require-flags FLAG [FLAG ...]
                        Only enable modules with these flags (e.g. -rf passive)
  -ef, --exclude-flags FLAG [FLAG ...]
                        Disable modules with these flags. (e.g. -ef aggressive)
  --allow-deadly        Enable the use of highly aggressive modules

Scan:
  -n, --name SCAN_NAME  Name of scan (default: random)
  -v, --verbose         Be more verbose
  -d, --debug           Enable debugging
  -s, --silent          Be quiet
  --force               Run scan even in the case of condition violations or failed module setups
  -y, --yes             Skip scan confirmation prompt
  --fast-mode           Scan only the provided targets as fast as possible, with no extra discovery
  --dry-run             Abort before executing scan
  --current-preset      Show the current preset in YAML format
  --current-preset-full
                        Show the current preset in its full form, including defaults
  -mh, --module-help MODULE
                        Show help for a specific module

Output:
  -o, --output-dir DIR  Directory to output scan results
  -om, --output-modules MODULE [MODULE ...]
                        Output module(s). Choices: asset_inventory,csv,discord,emails,http,json,mysql,neo4j,nmap_xml,postgres,python,slack,splunk,sqlite,stdout,subdomains,teams,txt,web_parameters,web_report,websocket
  -lo, --list-output-modules
                        List available output modules
  --json, -j            Output scan data in JSON format
  --brief, -br          Output only the data itself
  --event-types EVENT_TYPES [EVENT_TYPES ...]
                        Choose which event types to display
  --exclude-cdn, -ec    Filter out unwanted open ports on CDNs/WAFs (80,443 only)

Module dependencies:
  Control how modules install their dependencies

  --no-deps             Don't install module dependencies
  --force-deps          Force install all module dependencies
  --retry-deps          Try again to install failed module dependencies
  --ignore-failed-deps  Run modules even if they have failed dependencies
  --install-all-deps    Install dependencies for all modules

Misc:
  --version             show BBOT version and exit
  --proxy HTTP_PROXY    Use this proxy for all HTTP requests
  -H, --custom-headers CUSTOM_HEADERS [CUSTOM_HEADERS ...]
                        List of custom headers as key value pairs (header=value).
  --custom-yara-rules, -cy CUSTOM_YARA_RULES
                        Add custom yara rules to excavate
  --user-agent, -ua USER_AGENT
                        Set the user-agent for all HTTP requests

EXAMPLES

    Subdomains:
        bbot -t evilcorp.com -p subdomain-enum

    Subdomains (passive only):
        bbot -t evilcorp.com -p subdomain-enum -rf passive

    Subdomains + port scan + web screenshots:
        bbot -t evilcorp.com -p subdomain-enum -m portscan gowitness -n my_scan -o .

    Subdomains + basic web scan:
        bbot -t evilcorp.com -p subdomain-enum web-basic

    Web spider:
        bbot -t www.evilcorp.com -p spider -c web.spider_distance=2 web.spider_depth=2

    Everything everywhere all at once:
        bbot -t evilcorp.com -p kitchen-sink

    List modules:
        bbot -l

    List output modules:
        bbot -lo

    List presets:
        bbot -lp

    List flags:
        bbot -lf

    Show help for a specific module:
        bbot -mh <module_name>

```

TITLE: Creating a Basic WHOIS Module in Python
DESCRIPTION: A complete example of a simple BBOT module that performs WHOIS lookups. It demonstrates the module structure, including watched and produced events, configuration options, setup method, and event handling logic.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blacklanternsecurity/bbot/blob/stable/docs/dev/module_howto.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from bbot.modules.base import BaseModule

class whois(BaseModule):
    watched_events = ["DNS_NAME"] # watch for DNS_NAME events
    produced_events = ["WHOIS"] # we produce WHOIS events
    flags = ["passive", "safe"]
    meta = {"description": "Query WhoisXMLAPI for WHOIS data"}
    options = {"api_key": ""} # module config options
    options_desc = {"api_key": "WhoisXMLAPI Key"}
    per_domain_only = True # only run once per domain

    base_url = "https://www.whoisxmlapi.com/whoisserver/WhoisService"

    # one-time setup - runs at the beginning of the scan
    async def setup(self):
        self.api_key = self.config.get("api_key")
        if not self.api_key:
            # soft-fail if no API key is set
            return None, "Must set API key"

    async def handle_event(self, event):
        self.hugesuccess(f"Got {event} (event.data: {event.data})")
        _, domain = self.helpers.split_domain(event.data)
        url = f"{self.base_url}?apiKey={self.api_key}&domainName={domain}&outputFormat=JSON"
        self.hugeinfo(f"Visiting {url}")
        response = await self.helpers.request(url)
        if response is not None:
            await self.emit_event(response.json(), "WHOIS", parent=event)
```

TITLE: Using BBOT Helper Functions in Python Module
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use various BBOT helper functions within a module class, including making web requests, performing DNS resolution, executing shell commands, and splitting domain names.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blacklanternsecurity/bbot/blob/stable/docs/dev/helpers/index.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
class MyModule(BaseModule):

    ...

    async def handle_event(self, event):
        # Web Request
        response = await self.helpers.request("https://www.evilcorp.com")

        # DNS query
        for ip in await self.helpers.resolve("www.evilcorp.com"):
            self.hugesuccess(str(ip))

        # Execute shell command
        completed_process = await self.run_process("ls", "-l")
        self.hugesuccess(completed_process.stdout)

        # Split a DNS name into subdomain / domain
        self.helpers.split_domain("www.internal.evilcorp.co.uk")
        # ("www.internal", "evilcorp.co.uk")
```

TITLE: BBOT Default Configuration Settings
DESCRIPTION: The complete default configuration for BBOT, including settings for basic options, scope, DNS, web interactions, engine parameters, and advanced options.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blacklanternsecurity/bbot/blob/stable/docs/scanning/configuration.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
### BASIC OPTIONS ###

# BBOT working directory
home: ~/.bbot
# How many scan results to keep before cleaning up the older ones
keep_scans: 20
# Interval for displaying status messages
status_frequency: 15
# Include the raw data of files (i.e. PDFs, web screenshots) as base64 in the event
file_blobs: false
# Include the raw data of directories (i.e. git repos) as tar.gz base64 in the event
folder_blobs: false

### SCOPE ###

scope:
  # strict scope means only exact DNS names are considered in-scope
  # subdomains are not included unless they are explicitly provided in the target list
  strict: false
  # Filter by scope distance which events are displayed in the output
  # 0 == show only in-scope events (affiliates are always shown)
  # 1 == show all events up to distance-1 (1 hop from target)
  report_distance: 0
  # How far out from the main scope to search
  # Do not change this setting unless you know what you're doing
  search_distance: 0

### DNS ###

dns:
  # Completely disable DNS resolution (careful if you have IP whitelists/blacklists, consider using minimal=true instead)
  disable: false
  # Speed up scan by not creating any new DNS events, and only resolving A and AAAA records
  minimal: false
  # How many instances of the dns module to run concurrently
  threads: 25
  # How many concurrent DNS resolvers to use when brute-forcing
  # (under the hood this is passed through directly to massdns -s)
  brute_threads: 1000
  # nameservers to use for DNS brute-forcing
  # default is updated weekly and contains ~10K high-quality public servers
  brute_nameservers: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/blacklanternsecurity/public-dns-servers/master/nameservers.txt
  # How far away from the main target to explore via DNS resolution (independent of scope.search_distance)
  # This is safe to change
  search_distance: 1
  # Limit how many DNS records can be followed in a row (stop malicious/runaway DNS records)
  runaway_limit: 5
  # DNS query timeout
  timeout: 5
  # How many times to retry DNS queries
  retries: 1
  # Completely disable BBOT's DNS wildcard detection
  wildcard_disable: False
  # Disable BBOT's DNS wildcard detection for select domains
  wildcard_ignore: []
  # How many sanity checks to make when verifying wildcard DNS
  # Increase this value if BBOT's wildcard detection isn't working
  wildcard_tests: 10
  # Skip DNS requests for a certain domain and rdtype after encountering this many timeouts or SERVFAILs
  # This helps prevent faulty DNS servers from hanging up the scan
  abort_threshold: 50
  # Don't show PTR records containing IP addresses
  filter_ptrs: true
  # Enable/disable debug messages for DNS queries
  debug: false
  # For performance reasons, always skip these DNS queries
  # Microsoft's DNS infrastructure is misconfigured so that certain queries to mail.protection.outlook.com always time out
  omit_queries:
    - SRV:mail.protection.outlook.com
    - CNAME:mail.protection.outlook.com
    - TXT:mail.protection.outlook.com

### WEB ###

web:
  # HTTP proxy
  http_proxy:
  # Web user-agent
  user_agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/119.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 Edg/119.0.2151.97
  # Set the maximum number of HTTP links that can be followed in a row (0 == no spidering allowed)
  spider_distance: 0
  # Set the maximum directory depth for the web spider
  spider_depth: 1
  # Set the maximum number of links that can be followed per page
  spider_links_per_page: 25
  # HTTP timeout (for Python requests; API calls, etc.)
  http_timeout: 10
  # HTTP timeout (for httpx)
  httpx_timeout: 5
  # Custom HTTP headers (e.g. cookies, etc.)
  # in the format { "Header-Key": "header_value" }
  # These are attached to all in-scope HTTP requests
  # Note that some modules (e.g. github) may end up sending these to out-of-scope resources
  http_headers: {}
  # HTTP retries (for Python requests; API calls, etc.)
  http_retries: 1
  # HTTP retries (for httpx)
  httpx_retries: 1
  # Enable/disable debug messages for web requests/responses
  debug: false
  # Maximum number of HTTP redirects to follow
  http_max_redirects: 5
  # Whether to verify SSL certificates
  ssl_verify: false

### ENGINE ###

engine:
  debug: false

# Tool dependencies
deps:
  ffuf:
    version: "2.1.0"
  # How to handle installation of module dependencies
  # Choices are:
  #  - abort_on_failure (default) - if a module dependency fails to install, abort the scan
  #  - retry_failed - try again to install failed dependencies
  #  - ignore_failed - run the scan regardless of what happens with dependency installation
  #  - disable - completely disable BBOT's dependency system (you are responsible for installing tools, pip packages, etc.)
  behavior: abort_on_failure

### ADVANCED OPTIONS ###

# Load BBOT modules from these custom paths
module_dirs: []

# Infer certain events from others, e.g. IPs from IP ranges, DNS_NAMEs from URLs, etc.
speculate: True
# Passively search event data for URLs, hostnames, emails, etc.
excavate: True
# Summarize activity at the end of a scan
aggregate: True
# DNS resolution, wildcard detection, etc.
dnsresolve: True
# Cloud provider tagging
cloudcheck: True

# Strip querystring from URLs by default
url_querystring_remove: True
# When query string is retained, by default collapse parameter values down to a single value per parameter
url_querystring_collapse: True

# Completely ignore URLs with these extensions
url_extension_blacklist:
  # images
  - png
  - jpg
  - bmp
  - ico
  - jpeg
  - gif
  - svg
  - webp
  # web/fonts
  - css
  - woff
  - woff2
  - ttf
  - eot
  - sass
  - scss
  # audio
  - mp3
  - m4a
  - wav
  - flac
  # video
  - mp4
  - mkv
  - avi
  - wmv
  - mov
  - flv
  - webm
# Distribute URLs with these extensions only to httpx (these are omitted from output)
url_extension_httpx_only:
  - js

# These url extensions are almost always static, so we exclude them from modules that fuzz things
url_extension_static:
  - pdf
  - doc
  - docx
  - xls
  - xlsx
  - ppt
  - pptx
  - txt
  - csv
  - xml
  - yaml
  - ini
  - log
  - conf
  - cfg
  - env
  - md
  - rtf
  - tiff
  - bmp
  - jpg
  - jpeg
  - png
  - gif
  - svg
  - ico
  - mp3
  - wav
  - flac
  - mp4
  - mov
  - avi
  - mkv
  - webm
  - zip
  - tar
  - gz
  - bz2
  - 7z
  - rar
  
# Don't output these types of events (they are still distributed to modules)
omit_event_types:
  - HTTP_RESPONSE
  - RAW_TEXT
  - URL_UNVERIFIED
  - DNS_NAME_UNRESOLVED
  - FILESYSTEM
  - WEB_PARAMETER
  - RAW_DNS_RECORD
  # - IP_ADDRESS

# Custom interactsh server settings
interactsh_server: null
interactsh_token: null
interactsh_disable: false
```

TITLE: Using BBOT as a Synchronous Python Library
DESCRIPTION: Example of how to use BBOT as a synchronous Python library for subdomain enumeration. This snippet creates a Scanner object with a target domain and preset, then iterates through the scan results.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blacklanternsecurity/bbot/blob/stable/docs/scanning/advanced.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from bbot.scanner import Scanner

if __name__ == "__main__":
    scan = Scanner("evilcorp.com", presets=["subdomain-enum"])
    for event in scan.start():
        print(event)
```

TITLE: Initializing BaseModule with Scanner in Python
DESCRIPTION: Constructor method for BaseModule that initializes the module with a scanner instance. It sets up essential attributes like event queues, HTTP clients, and module configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blacklanternsecurity/bbot/blob/stable/docs/dev/basemodule.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
def __init__(self, scanner=None):
        from bbot.scanner import Scanner as BBOTScanner

        self.blacklist = set()
        self.output_masks = set()
        self.modules_run = set()
        self.completed = threading.Event()
        self._seen_hashes = set()
        self.watching_targets = {}
        self._abort = False
        self.start_time = None
        self.stop_time = None
        self.start_event = None
        self.new_event_time = None
        self._cached_events = {}
        self._in_q = eventlet.queue.Queue()
        self._event_semaphore = eventlet.semaphore.Semaphore(500)
        self.name = getattr(self, "name", get_module_name(self.__module__))
        self.batch_size = 100
        self.batch_wait = 0.0
        self.allow_events_during_abort = False
        self._scanner_registered = False
        self._event_stats = {}
        self._processed_stats = defaultdict(int)
        self._batch = []
        self._lock = eventlet.semaphore.Semaphore(1)
        self._masked_events = {}
        self._http_timeout = 30
        self._task_pool = TaskPool(threshold=9999)
        self.errors = {}
        self._error_count = defaultdict(int)
        self.scanner = None
        if scanner:
            if isinstance(scanner, BBOTScanner):
                self.scanner = scanner
            else:
                self.scanner = scanner.scanner
        self.human_name = get_human_name(self)
```

TITLE: Implementing Scanner Class in Python for BBOT
DESCRIPTION: Defines the Scanner class which is the core component of BBOT. It handles module management, event processing, scan configuration, and orchestrates the scanning process across multiple target modules.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blacklanternsecurity/bbot/blob/stable/docs/dev/scanner.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
class Scanner:
    """The scanner manages modules, processes events, and manages the scan. Data about those events is stored in a database."""

    def __init__(self, config=None):
        """
        Initialize a new Scanner instance.

        Args:
            config (Config, optional): Use this config object. Otherwise, a default config will be used.
        """

        self.log = logging.getLogger("bbot.scanner")
        self.log.info("Instantiating scanner")

        self.start_time = time.time()
        # events seen
        self._seen_cache = set()
        # modules initialized
        self._mod_init = set()
        self._results_lock = threading.RLock()
        # all modules
        self.modules = {}
        # maps modules to their flags, e.g. {"shodan": set(["web", "passive", "api"])}
        self.module_flags = {}
        # maps module flags to their corresponding modules, e.g. {"web": set(["shodan", "httpx"]), "dns": set(["dnsresolve", "dnscommonsrv"])}
        self.flag_modules = {}
        # event_type --> module --> flag --> list([module_instance])
        self.event_module_map = {}
        # maps "hostname" --> set("shodan", "censys", ...)
        self._module_for_event_type = {}

        # list of (event_type, module) tracked for "tracked events"
        self._tracked_events = {}
        # word --> module instance
        self.word_module_map = defaultdict(dict)
        self._mod_track_done = set()

        # a database to store results in
        self.db = None

        self.scan_id = None
        self.parent_scan_id = None
        # keep track of module config
        self.config = config if config else Config()

        self._setup_modules()
        self._make_event_map()
```

TITLE: Implementing Module Lifecycle Methods in Python
DESCRIPTION: Implementation of module lifecycle methods including initialization, pre/post-processing hooks, and finalization methods for the BaseModule class.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blacklanternsecurity/bbot/blob/stable/docs/dev/basemodule.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
def setup(self):
        """Set up the module.

        This is called before modules run, so modules can set themselves up.
        Returns boolean indicating success/failure.
        """
        return True

    def filter_event(self, event):
        """Filter incoming events. Return True to continue processing, False to skip."""
        return True

    def process_event(self, event):
        """Process the event.

        This is a generator. Here, modules conduct their processing of an event,
        and can use yield to return produced events.
        """
        raise NotImplementedError()

    def post_process_event(self, event):
        """Process an event after it has been processed by process_event().

        Useful for doing things only after a successful process_event()
        """
        pass

    def cleanup(self):
        """Clean up the module before the scan finishes."""
        pass

    def pre_scan(self):
        """Run before the first events start getting processed.

        Modules can do expensive work upfront, potentially yielding events like
        process_event().
        """
        return
        yield  # noqa: W0101

    def post_scan(self):
        """Run after all other events are finished processing, for cleanup work.

        Modules have the opportunity to yield events like process_event() here as well.
        For example, to summarize findings of the scan itself.
        """
        return
        yield  # noqa: W0101
```

TITLE: Implementing Event Processing Methods in Python
DESCRIPTION: Core event processing methods for BaseModule that handle event filtering, processing, and dispatching according to module configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blacklanternsecurity/bbot/blob/stable/docs/dev/basemodule.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
def accept_event(self, event):
        module_event_type = f"{self.name}:{event.type}"
        # if we're watching this target
        if event.source in self.watching_targets:
            # and it's an event type we want to watch
            watch_types = self.watching_targets[event.source]
            # if we're watching all event types, or this specific one
            if "*" in watch_types or event.type in watch_types:
                return True

        # otherwise, make sure we haven't blacklisted this event
        if event.hash in self.blacklist:
            return False

        # check if we've masked this event
        for m in self.output_masks:
            if fnmatch(module_event_type, m):
                return False
            if fnmatch(event.type, m):
                return False

        # only care about events with which we're compatible
        if not self.watched_events:
            return False
        if "*" in self.watched_events:
            return True

        # Check if the module is interested in the event type
        event_matches = False
        for e in self.watched_events:
            if fnmatch(event.type, e):
                event_matches = True

        return event_matches
```

TITLE: Implementing Error Handling in BaseModule
DESCRIPTION: Error handling methods for BaseModule including error tracking, logging, and exception management during event processing and module operations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blacklanternsecurity/bbot/blob/stable/docs/dev/basemodule.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
def error(self, *args, **kwargs):
        """Log an error message"""
        return self.log("error", args, kwargs)

    def register_error(self, e):
        """Register an error and keep track of the count"""
        try:
            error_message = make_exception_message(e)
            self._error_count[error_message] += 1
            self.errors[error_message] = e
        except Exception as e:
            self.warning(f"Error registering error: {e}")

    def _safe_process_event(self, event):
        """Error-catching wrapper around _event_process_hub"""
        try:
            with self._lock:
                self.new_event_time = time.time()
                if self.start_event is None:
                    self.start_event = event
            result = self._event_process_hub(event)
            with self._lock:
                self.new_event_time = time.time()
            return result
        except Exception as e:
            self.register_error(e)
            self.error(f"Error processing event {event}: {make_exception_message(e)}")
            tb = traceback.format_exc()
            self.debug(tb)
        finally:
            self._event_semaphore.release()
```

```
| modules.ffuf.ignore_case                       | bool     | Only put lowercase words into the wordlist                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     | False                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| modules.ffuf.lines                             | int      | take only the first N lines from the wordlist when finding directories                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         | 5000                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| modules.ffuf.max_depth                         | int      | the maximum directory depth to attempt to solve                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                | 0                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| modules.ffuf.rate                              | int      | Rate of requests per second (default: 0)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       | 0                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
```

```
@property
    def debug(self):
        return self.config.get(f"{self.name}:debug", False)

    @property
    def id(self):
        return f"{self.name}/{id(self)}"

    @property
    def type(self):
        return f"{get_module_name(self.__class__.__module__)}_module"

    @property
    def config(self):
        if hasattr(self, "scanner") and self.scanner is not None:
            return self.scanner.config
        return {}

    @property
    def helpers(self):
        if hasattr(self, "scanner") and self.scanner is not None:
            return self.scanner.helpers
        return None

    @property
    def http(self):
        """Returns the module's HTTP client"""
        if not self.scanner:
            raise ValueError("Module is not linked to a scanner")
        return self.scanner.helpers.session(self.name, timeout=self._http_timeout)
```

TITLE: Defining Preset Class for BBOT Scanner in Python
DESCRIPTION: Implementation of the Preset class for BBOT scanner that handles loading, validation, and management of scan configuration presets from YAML files or dictionaries. The class provides methods to validate presets against a schema and merge preset configurations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blacklanternsecurity/bbot/blob/stable/docs/dev/presets.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
class Preset:
    """BBOT scanners can be initialized with a "preset", which is a file that contains scan settings.
    """

    def __init__(self, preset=None, presets_dir=None):
        self.name = None
        self.description = ""  # will be shown in --help
        self.modules = []
        self.helpers = {}  # {"port_scanner": "masscan"}
        self.tags = []  # ["active"]
        self.flags = {}  # {"dns_resolution": false}
        self.config = {}  # {"masscan": {"rate": 1000}}
        self.omit_from_summary = False
        if preset is not None:
            self.apply_preset(preset, presets_dir=presets_dir)

    def apply_preset(self, preset, presets_dir=None):
        """Apply settings from a preset to the current preset object

        preset: path to yaml preset file, yaml string, preset name, or dict

        presets_dir defaults to presets directory in bbot home
        """
        import yaml

        if isinstance(preset, (str, bytes)):
            preset = preset.strip()
            # is it a preset name?
            if isinstance(preset, str) and len(preset.split()) == 1 and "/" not in preset and "\\" not in preset:
                if not presets_dir:
                    from bbot.core.configurator.configurator import home_dir

                    presets_dir = home_dir / "presets"
                preset_files = sorted(presets_dir.glob(f"**/{preset}.yml")) + sorted(
                    presets_dir.glob(f"**/{preset}.yaml")
                )
                if not preset_files:
                    preset_files = sorted(presets_dir.glob(f"**/*{preset}*.yml")) + sorted(
                        presets_dir.glob(f"**/*{preset}*.yaml")
                    )
                if not preset_files:
                    raise ValueError(f'Preset "{preset}" not found in {presets_dir}')
                preset_file = preset_files[0]
                if len(preset_files) > 1:
                    ambiguous = "\n".join([str(p) for p in preset_files])
                    log.warning(f"Ambiguous preset name: {preset}. Using {preset_file}\nOptions:\n{ambiguous}")
                try:
                    with open(preset_file, "r") as f:
                        preset = yaml.safe_load(f) or {}
                except Exception as e:
                    raise ValueError(f"Error loading preset from {preset_file}: {e}")
                self.name = preset_file.stem
            # is it yaml?
            else:
                try:
                    parsed = yaml.safe_load(preset) or {}
                    if parsed and isinstance(parsed, dict):
                        preset = parsed
                        if "name" in preset:
                            self.name = preset["name"]
                except Exception:
                    pass

        # is it a dict?
        if isinstance(preset, dict):
            preset = self.validate(preset)
            for k, v in preset.items():
                if k == "name":
                    self.name = v
                elif k == "description":
                    self.description = v
                elif k == "omit_from_summary":
                    self.omit_from_summary = v
                elif k == "modules":
                    self.modules = list(v)
                elif k == "helpers":
                    self.helpers.update(v)
                elif k == "flags":
                    self.flags.update(v)
                elif k == "tags":
                    self.tags = list(v)
                elif k == "config":
                    from bbot.core.configurator.util import merge_configs

                    self.config = merge_configs(self.config, v)
        else:
            raise ValueError(f"Unable to load preset: {preset}")
        return self

    def validate(self, preset):
        """Validate preset against schema"""
        from schema import Schema, Optional, Or, Use, SchemaError

        schema = Schema(
            {
                Optional("name"): str,
                Optional("description"): str,
                Optional("omit_from_summary"): bool,
                Optional("modules"): [str],
                Optional("helpers"): {str: str},
                Optional("tags"): [str],
                Optional("flags"): {str: Or(bool, str, list, dict)},
                Optional("config"): {
                    str: {
                        str: Use(lambda v: v),
                    }
                },
            }
        )
        try:
            preset = schema.validate(preset)
        except SchemaError as e:
            raise ValueError(f"Schema validation failed: {e}")
        return preset

    def as_dict(self):
        return {
            "name": self.name,
            "description": self.description,
            "modules": self.modules,
            "helpers": self.helpers,
            "tags": self.tags,
            "flags": self.flags,
            "config": self.config,
            "omit_from_summary": self.omit_from_summary,
        }

    def merge_with(self, other_preset, overwrite=True):
        """Merge two presets together

        Attributes in other_preset will overwrite self's attributes if overwrite=True (default)
        """
        from bbot.core.configurator.util import merge_configs

        merged_dict = self.as_dict()
        other_dict = other_preset.as_dict()

        # simple attributes
        if other_dict["name"] is not None:
            merged_dict["name"] = other_dict["name"]
        if other_dict["description"]:
            merged_dict["description"] = other_dict["description"]

        # modules
        original_modules = set(merged_dict["modules"])
        other_modules = set(other_dict["modules"])
        if not overwrite:
            merged_dict["modules"] = sorted(list(original_modules.union(other_modules)))
        else:
            if other_modules:
                merged_dict["modules"] = sorted(list(other_modules))

        # tags
        original_tags = set(merged_dict["tags"])
        other_tags = set(other_dict["tags"])
        if not overwrite:
            merged_dict["tags"] = sorted(list(original_tags.union(other_tags)))
        else:
            if other_tags:
                merged_dict["tags"] = sorted(list(other_tags))

        # helpers (simple dict merge)
        if not overwrite:
            for k, v in other_dict["helpers"].items():
                if k not in merged_dict["helpers"]:
                    merged_dict["helpers"][k] = v
        else:
            merged_dict["helpers"].update(other_dict["helpers"])

        # flags (simple dict merge)
        if not overwrite:
            for k, v in other_dict["flags"].items():
                if k not in merged_dict["flags"]:
                    merged_dict["flags"][k] = v
        else:
            merged_dict["flags"].update(other_dict["flags"])

        # config (deep dict merge)
        merged_dict["config"] = merge_configs(merged_dict["config"], other_dict["config"], overwrite=overwrite)

        merged_preset = self.__class__()
        for k, v in merged_dict.items():
            setattr(merged_preset, k, v)
        return merged_preset
```

```
        - cfm
```

TITLE: BBOT Module Test Example
DESCRIPTION: Example implementation of a BBOT module test including setup and validation logic.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blacklanternsecurity/bbot/blob/stable/docs/dev/tests.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from .base import ModuleTestBase


class TestMyModule(ModuleTestBase):
    targets = ["blacklanternsecurity.com"]
    config_overrides = {"modules": {"mymodule": {"api_key": "deadbeef"}}}

    async def setup_after_prep(self, module_test):
        # mock HTTP response
        module_test.httpx_mock.add_response(
            url="https://api.com/sudomains?apikey=deadbeef&domain=blacklanternsecurity.com",
            json={
                "subdomains": [
                    "www.blacklanternsecurity.com",
                    "dev.blacklanternsecurity.com"
                ],
            },
        )
        # mock DNS
        await module_test.mock_dns(
            {
                "blacklanternsecurity.com": {"A": ["1.2.3.4"]},
                "www.blacklanternsecurity.com": {"A": ["1.2.3.4"]},
                "dev.blacklanternsecurity.com": {"A": ["1.2.3.4"]},
            }
        )

    def check(self, module_test, events):
        # here is where we check to make sure it worked
        dns_names = [e.data for e in events if e.type == "DNS_NAME"]
        # temporary log messages for debugging
        for e in dns_names:
            self.log.critical(e)
        assert "www.blacklanternsecurity.com" in dns_names, "failed to find subdomain #1"
        assert "dev.blacklanternsecurity.com" in dns_names, "failed to find subdomain #2"
```

TITLE: Implementing Discord Bot for BBOT Scanning in Python
DESCRIPTION: This script creates a Discord bot that can run BBOT scans. It uses the discord.py library to interact with Discord's API and the BBOT library for scanning functionality. The bot responds to commands to start scans, check scan status, and retrieve results.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blacklanternsecurity/bbot/blob/stable/docs/dev/discord_bot.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Python
CODE:
```
import asyncio
import discord
from discord.ext import commands
from bbot.scanner import Scanner

intents = discord.Intents.default()
intents.message_content = True

bot = commands.Bot(command_prefix='!', intents=intents)

active_scans = {}

@bot.event
async def on_ready():
    print(f'We have logged in as {bot.user}')

@bot.command()
async def scan(ctx, target):
    if ctx.author.id in active_scans:
        await ctx.send(f'You already have an active scan. Use !status to check its progress.')
        return

    scanner = Scanner(
        target,
        output_modules=['json'],
        allow_deadly=True,
        output_dir=f'discord_bot_scans/{ctx.author.id}',
    )
    active_scans[ctx.author.id] = scanner
    await ctx.send(f'Starting scan of {target}...')
    await scanner.async_start()
    await ctx.send(f'Scan of {target} complete! Use !results to view the results.')
    del active_scans[ctx.author.id]

@bot.command()
async def status(ctx):
    if ctx.author.id not in active_scans:
        await ctx.send('You have no active scans.')
        return

    scanner = active_scans[ctx.author.id]
    await ctx.send(f'Scan is {scanner.percent_complete}% complete.')

@bot.command()
async def results(ctx):
    results_file = f'discord_bot_scans/{ctx.author.id}/results.json'
    try:
        with open(results_file, 'r') as f:
            await ctx.send(file=discord.File(results_file))
    except FileNotFoundError:
        await ctx.send('No results found. Have you run a scan yet?')

bot.run('YOUR_BOT_TOKEN_HERE')

```

TITLE: Initializing Interact.sh Integration in Python for BBOT
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet defines the Interactsh class, which handles the integration with the Interact.sh service. It includes methods for starting the client, generating correlation IDs, and retrieving interaction logs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blacklanternsecurity/bbot/blob/stable/docs/dev/helpers/interactsh.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
class Interactsh:\n    def __init__(self, scan):\n        self.scan = scan\n        self.log = self.scan.log\n        self.client = None\n        self.correlation_id = str(uuid.uuid4())\n        self.start_time = None\n        self.token = None\n        self.server = None\n        self.correlation_id_url = None\n\n    def start(self):\n        if self.client:\n            return True\n        try:\n            self.client = interactsh.Client(\n                self.scan.config.get(\"interactsh_server\", \"\"),\n                self.scan.config.get(\"interactsh_token\", \"\"),\n                self.scan.config.get(\"interactsh_no_http_fallback\", False),\n            )\n            self.token = self.client.token\n            self.server = self.client.server\n            self.correlation_id_url = f\"{self.correlation_id}.{self.server}\"\n            self.start_time = time.time()\n            return True\n        except Exception as e:\n            self.log.warning(f\"Failed to start interactsh client: {e}\")\n        return False\n\n    def stop(self):\n        if self.client:\n            try:\n                self.client.close()\n            except Exception as e:\n                self.log.debug(f\"Error closing interactsh client: {e}\")\n        self.client = None\n\n    def gen_domain(self, correlation_id=None):\n        if correlation_id is None:\n            correlation_id = self.correlation_id\n        return f\"{correlation_id}.{self.server}\"\n\n    def get_interactions(self, correlation_id=None, poll_count=1):\n        if not self.client:\n            return []\n        interactions = []\n        correlation_ids = [correlation_id] if correlation_id else [self.correlation_id]\n        try:\n            for _ in range(poll_count):\n                logs = self.client.poll()\n                for interaction in logs:\n                    for cid in correlation_ids:\n                        if cid in interaction[\"full-id\"]:\n                            interactions.append(interaction)\n                            break\n        except Exception as e:\n            self.log.debug(f\"Error polling interactsh: {e}\")\n        return interactions
```

TITLE: Configuring Nuclei-Budget Preset in YAML for BBOT
DESCRIPTION: A resource-efficient BBOT preset for running Nuclei scans with budget limitations. It configures Nuclei to use budget mode with a limit of 10 requests, targeting low-hanging vulnerabilities while minimizing resource usage.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blacklanternsecurity/bbot/blob/stable/docs/scanning/presets_list.md#2025-04-23_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
description: Run nuclei scans against all discovered targets, using budget mode to look for low hanging fruit with greatly reduced number of requests

modules:
  - httpx
  - nuclei
  - portfilter

config:
  modules:
    nuclei:
      mode: budget
      budget: 10
      directory_only: true # Do not run nuclei on individual non-directory URLs

conditions:
  - |
    {% if config.web.spider_distance != 0 %}
      {{ warn("Running nuclei with spider enabled is generally not recommended. Consider removing 'spider' preset.") }}
    {% endif %}
```

TITLE: Configuring Nuclei-Intense Preset in YAML for BBOT
DESCRIPTION: An aggressive BBOT preset for comprehensive Nuclei scanning with additional discovery modules. It configures Nuclei to scan all URLs (not just directories) and includes robots.txt parsing, URL scanning, and wayback machine integration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blacklanternsecurity/bbot/blob/stable/docs/scanning/presets_list.md#2025-04-23_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
description: Run nuclei scans against all discovered targets, allowing for spidering, against ALL URLs, and with additional discovery modules.

modules:
  - httpx
  - nuclei
  - robots
  - urlscan
  - portfilter
  - wayback

config:
  modules:
    nuclei:
      directory_only: False # Will run nuclei on ALL discovered URLs - Be careful!
    wayback:
      urls: true

conditions:
  - |
    {% if config.web.spider_distance == 0 and config.modules.nuclei.directory_only == False %}
      {{ warn("The 'nuclei-intense' preset turns the 'directory_only' limitation off on the nuclei module. To make the best use of this, you may want to enable spidering with 'spider' or 'spider-intense' preset.") }}
    {% endif %}


# Example for also running a dirbust

#include:
#  - dirbust-light
```

TITLE: Defining BaseModule Class for BBOT in Python
DESCRIPTION: Implementation of the BaseModule class that serves as the foundation for all BBOT modules. It manages module configuration, event handling, and provides core functionality and lifecycle methods that all modules inherit.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blacklanternsecurity/bbot/blob/stable/docs/dev/basemodule.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
class BaseModule(abc.ABC):
    """Base class for modules.

    The base module class provides core functionality for all BBOT modules,
    everything from logging, to event handling, to accessing an HTTP client.
    """

    watched_events = set()
    produced_events = set()
    flags = set()
    meta = {}
    options = {}
    conflicts = set()
    scope_distance_modifier = 0
    recursive_scope_distance_modifier = 0
```

TITLE: Implementing Event Emission Methods in Python
DESCRIPTION: Methods for creating and emitting events from the BaseModule, including event verification, source tracking, and scope checking.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blacklanternsecurity/bbot/blob/stable/docs/dev/basemodule.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
def _validate_emitted_event(self, event):
        """Make sure an event meets our standards"""
        # check if the module shouldn't produce any events
        if not self.produced_events:
            self.warning(f"Module emitted {event.type} but produced_events is empty")
            return False

        # handle wildcard
        if "*" in self.produced_events:
            return True

        # otherwise make sure the event's type is among those that the module claims to emit
        event_matches = False
        for e in self.produced_events:
            if fnmatch(event.type, e):
                event_matches = True
        if not event_matches:
            types_string = "', '".join(sorted(self.produced_events))
            self.warning(
                f"Module is not supposed to emit {event.type}, only '{types_string}'"
            )
            return False

        return True

    def emit_event(self, *args, **kwargs):
        """Create and emit an event in one swoop"""
        try:
            if len(args) == 1 and isinstance(args[0], Event):
                # we got a raw event
                event = args[0]
            else:
                # passed in args and kwargs to create an event
                event = self.make_event(*args, **kwargs)
        except Exception as e:
            self.warning(f"Error creating event: {make_exception_message(e)}")
            return False

        if not self._validate_emitted_event(event):
            return False

        self._processed_stats[event.type] += 1
        is_in_scope = self.scanner.is_in_scope(event)
        if self.scanner and not is_in_scope:
            if not event.in_scope:
                if self.debug:
                    self.debug_event(
                        event, f"Filtered (not in scope, distance {event.scope_distance})"
                    )
                return False

        if self.scanner and self.scanner.use_ingestor:
            self.scanner.emit_event(event)

        # look for watchers
        if event.source in self.watching_targets:
            # check if the watcher wants this event type
            for event_type in (event.type, "*"):
                masking_info = self._masked_events.get((event.source, event_type))
                if masking_info:
                    mask_id, parent_module = masking_info
                    self.debug_event(
                        event,
                        f"Masked by {parent_module} (ID: {mask_id}, watching {event.source})",
                    )
                    return True

        if self.debug:
            self.debug_event(event, f"Created")

        return True

    def make_event(self, data=None, event_type=None, source=None, module=None, tags=None, **kwargs):
        """Helper to create events. Accepts an Event or kwargs to construct one."""

        module = module or self.name

        # Apply inherited tags
        if source and source in self._cached_events:
            # Apply tags from the source event
            source_event = self._cached_events[source]
            if not tags:
                tags = source_event.tags.copy()
            else:
                for t in source_event.tags:
                    if t not in tags:
                        tags.append(t)

        return Event(
            data=data,
            event_type=event_type,
            source=source,
            module=module,
            tags=tags,
            **kwargs,
        )
```

TITLE: Implementing Event Handling in BaseModule
DESCRIPTION: Implementation of event handling methods in BaseModule including processing, masking, and batching of events for efficient processing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blacklanternsecurity/bbot/blob/stable/docs/dev/basemodule.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
def _process_event(self, event):
        """Process a single event"""
        if self._abort and not self.allow_events_during_abort:
            return

        if not self.accept_event(event):
            if self.debug:
                self.debug_event(event, f"Skipped")
            return

        self._event_stats[event.type] = self._event_stats.get(event.type, 0) + 1

        self._batch.append(event)
        current_batch_size = len(self._batch)

        processed_all = False
        if current_batch_size >= self.batch_size:
            processed_all = self._process_events_in_batch()

        if processed_all:
            self._batch = []
            if self.batch_wait > 0:
                eventlet.sleep(self.batch_wait)

    def _process_events_in_batch(self):
        """Process the events accumulated in self._batch"""
        try:
            if not self._batch:
                return True

            if self._task_pool.waiting() >= len(self._batch):
                self.warning(
                    f"Too many tasks waiting ({self._task_pool.waiting()}), skipping batch"
                )
                return False

            events = self._batch[:]
            for event in events:
                # Release the semaphore when we're done processing this event
                self._event_semaphore.acquire()
                self._task_pool.spawn(self._safe_process_event, event)

            return True
        except Exception as e:
            self.warning(
                f"Error processing batch of {len(self._batch)} events: {make_exception_message(e)}"
            )
            return False
```

TITLE: Retrieving Domains and IPs with Open TCP Ports
DESCRIPTION: Cypher query to fetch all in-scope domains and IP addresses that have open TCP ports, grouping the ports by host.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blacklanternsecurity/bbot/blob/stable/docs/scanning/output.md#2025-04-23_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: cypher
CODE:
```
// Get all domains and IP addresses with open TCP ports
MATCH (n) --> (p:OPEN_TCP_PORT)
WHERE "in-scope" in n.tags and (n:DNS_NAME or n:IP_ADDRESS)
WITH *, TAIL(SPLIT(p.data, ':')) AS port
RETURN n.data, collect(distinct port)
```

TITLE: Implementing Logging Methods in BaseModule
DESCRIPTION: Logging methods for BaseModule that provide structured logging capabilities with different severity levels and context information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blacklanternsecurity/bbot/blob/stable/docs/dev/basemodule.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
def warning(self, *args, **kwargs):
        """Log a warning message"""
        return self.log("warning", args, kwargs)

    def info(self, *args, **kwargs):
        """Log an informational message"""
        return self.log("info", args, kwargs)

    def verbose(self, *args, **kwargs):
        """Log a verbose message"""
        return self.log("verbose", args, kwargs)

    def debug(self, *args, **kwargs):
        """Log a debug message"""
        return self.log("debug", args, kwargs)

    def debug_event(self, event, msg):
        """Debug log an event with a custom message"""
        self.debug(
            f"{msg}: {event.type} ({event.data})",
            prefix="event",
            event_hash=str(event.hash),
        )

    def log(self, level, args=None, kwargs=None):
        """Log a message using the scanner's logger"""
        try:
            if not args:
                args = tuple()
            if not kwargs:
                kwargs = {}
            if self.scanner and hasattr(self.scanner, "log_"):
                return self.scanner.log_(level, *args, module=self.name, **kwargs)
            else:
                return getattr(logging, level)(*args)
        except Exception as e:
            try:
                error_message = f"Error logging message: {make_exception_message(e)}"
                if not self._abort:
                    logging.error(error_message)
            except:
                pass
```

TITLE: Referencing BBOT Engine Server Class
